title: Why is Zed immune to balancing?
body:
{{champion:238}}  is one of the most picked champions even though he is banned an nearly every game. He wrecks havoc in yoloQ and tournaments. Even when he's behind 2 kills he outdamages basically any mage but maybe {{champion:134}} (who already got nerfed on PBE). He shines with insane burst, damage sustain, mobility and pushing power, he destroys tanks and squishies alike. Did I mention his extremely slong low cooldown AoE slow which can be cast while moving?

Who does Riot nerf?
{{champion:37}} .

replies.body: Because {{champion:98}} is the balanced ninja and {{champion:238}} is his opposite.

He is immune to balancing the same reason {{champion:64}} can be considered immune to it. It's mechanical balance (which riot almost never touches) rather than a numerical one. You have two cases for champions like that, either their way below average because their numbers are so low or they are constantly on the top of the charts because their numbers aren't to low.
because hes already balanced. are you an adc? buy qss. are you an ap? buy zhonyas. if you dont follow my advice, you are just ignorant.

maybe not perfectly ballanced 
but nobody can disagree that he is the MOST BALLANCED ASSASIN atm 
he doesnt rely on any troll poles, infinite dashes, he cant burst 5 ppl down because he got resets  he just does his job and doesnt lack anything (he even has the mighty counterplay)

ppl complain about him because he is popular and heck i like to play him too but there are loads of champs which require riots look more than him

What, no. Talon does all those things and isn't as safe. Talon is literally the true assassin. High risk high reward. If you jump in at the wrong moment or mess up your combo your 2 second stealth isn't going to save you in the middle of teh team fight.

being an assasin is not tied to being high risk high reward 

also there is a big problem with high risk high reward champs  whic is the fact that their combos are usualy unavoidable unless your team pells for you 

so overall zed winns when it comes to being the healthiest assasin out there because he isnt innsanely opressive at solos and is peelable
Assasins are meant to be high risk high reward. Thats what assasins are supposed to be. Zed is not high risk therefore is unhealthy.

thats your opinion 
i look at the game and state the facts

its better to stop arguing
No you stated your opinion. The fact that you think your opinion is a fact renders your point of view useless.

QSS doesn't stop the insane damage, it just cleanses the mark so you might survive eventually. People have a problem with his absolute safety, much like (if I can assume this), your main, Lee Sin.

If the game was balanced around Lee and Zed, we'd all have a fun time deleting everyone off the map with a simple tap here and a whack there.

I don't even want to think about what it would be like to have a truly mobile Malphite.

during a teamfight late game, if you qss zeds ulti and hes wasted his energy, do you truly think he can be of use compared to other mids?
His energy will be back shortly, and he's still done a fuckton of damage. The rest of the team can follow up and Zed will get the assist.

assassins are supposed to be about risk and reward but zed has ranged poke, ground targeted blinks that don't use up any of his kit's burst. if there are no targets to assassinate he can just make some with his poke, if he gets caught out or misreads a situation and dives into danger he can just shadow swap back to safety. zed is all reward and no risk so there's no reason for pros not to pick him as long as they know how to play him.

also if he happens to be below average apparently riot will buff him out of nowhere because everyone wants to see the same champs every game every season
I play {{champion:105}} and I can almost always destroy {{champion:238}}
